transcripts.text: You what?  I can't hear you over the cars.  Am I what?  No.
Okay.  Just taking pictures?
Uh-huh.  Who am I with?  I'm a tourist.
Oh, okay.  Okay.  Just curious.  We're just curious.
It's just the cover of the building.  That's why we're just asking.  I know, it's the DEA.  Oh, okay, okay.  Are you guys just, are you just doing, like, birds, or?  You guys?  It's just me.
No, I know, but are you just doing, taking pictures of birds or tourists?
Taking pictures of the DEA building.
Oh, the DEA, okay.
No, just asking.
Yeah, that's it.  Okay.  Any particular reason?  For my use.  What's that?  For my use.
Okay, what would that use be?  I'm just curious.
Whatever I do with it.  Okay, okay, no problem.  That's it.  All right.  Howdy.

What's going on?  Nothing.  What are you doing with that camera?  Taking pictures.  Taking pictures of what?  Anything I can see.  Do you have a nightie with you?  I haven't done anything wrong, have I?  No, sir, but just taking pictures.  Yeah, I was taking pictures of...
That's why they're calling and complaining about you.
Oh, well, I was trying to leave, but I've got this DPS trooper that's following me around here, and he looks really suspicious.  Do you think you could stop him and check him out?
Why am I going to stop the DPS trooper if he's doing his job?
He looks suspicious.  He's like riding around here and stalking me.
He's not stalking you.
He's stalking me.
He's not stalking you.  Can I talk to you in here?  What?  Do you have an ID with you?
Am I being detained?
No, sir.  I'm just going to... Okay.
Well, I'm just going to go on about my business then.  I need to talk to you.
Okay?  I just need to identify you and that's it.  Other than that, you're free to leave after I identify you.
Okay?  So I'm being detained then?
Right now, I'm questioning you.  Yes, sir.
Okay.  You're not answering my question.  Am I being detained or am I free to go?
Right now, I'm going to question you.  Yes, sir.  I need your ID.
So I am being detained?  Yes, sir.  For what crime?  What crime?  Uh-huh.
There's no crime yet.  I just need to verify your ID and that's very quickly.  Other than that, you could go on and body your way.
I mean, are you T-Close certified?
Yes, sir.
I don't understand.  I'm not armed, by the way.  I have no weapons on me.
I don't see that you're armed or anything like that.

That's law enforcement 101.  What's law enforcement 101?  What do you need to detain somebody?  Reasonable, reasonable, articulable suspicion that crime has been or is about to be committed.  You just said there's no crime.
There's no crime.  I just need to ID yourself.
Then you cannot detain me.  Your detention would be unlawful.
I understand that, but I just need to ID you.
I got that, Officer Gonzalez.
What is your name?
I didn't give it.  I don't want to give it.  I haven't done anything wrong.
Does anybody want contact?  He's just taking pictures of the area.  He's going to leave the area.
If the trooper quits following me.
The trooper does not have anything to do with this.  You're not going to be in here?  Get out of here.
Now you're telling me to leave?  Yes, sir.
Have a good day.
I mean, if I'm being told to leave, I'm going to stay.  I haven't done anything wrong.
That's fine.  They come in.  Trooper decides to pick you up, he decides to pick you up.
Okay.  That's better, okay?  You're not telling me to leave now.  I appreciate that.  If the trooper leaves, I'm going to leave.  So I'm going to try to leave, okay?
I hope you leave.
I hope I do too.  Just get the trooper to quit following me.  Do you guys really want to play that game?

Okay.  At this point, I'm going to throw a quick comment in here so that you guys will understand what's going on.  Um, these DEA agents that are following me are being very aggressive.  They're being, you know, right out in the open.  Um, they're, they're basically trying to intimidate or scare me, get me to do something stupid.  Um, frequently after photographing a building, I'm followed.  Um, you know, when they, they stand off at a distance and just watch you and try to follow you.  That's one thing.  Um, I don't worry about that too much.  If, if by chance they happen to follow me back to my vehicle, uh, they're just going to get the vehicle information and then they're done.  But when they're openly following you and being aggressive like this, The reality is that if you get back to your vehicle, they are very likely going to have you stopped.  And when you're stopped under those circumstances, the probability of drugs being planted on you or something stupid like that is very high.  So I don't tolerate it.  What I did at this point is I called the DEA office and I told them, that they need to quit following me.  And I told them if they didn't, I would return to the DEA office, photograph every person, license plate, yada, yada, yada, and that I would publish it.  And I would do that until they decided that they wouldn't follow me anymore.  I went back and here's the video for that.  So then, a Cameron County Deputy Sheriff comes out to talk to me.  He doesn't appear in this video because he works undercover.  He came out and he told me that he would ensure, you know, he asked me what was going on and I told him.  And he said that he would ensure that I was not followed.  He kept his word and... So he does not appear in the video, nor do any more agents after that point.  Everything that you're seeing occurred prior to my conversation with that deputy.  And I told those people I was going to publish it.  And that is why it's published.  I generally don't do that.  But, you know, when they ask for it, you know, because that's what the guy on the phone said.  He said, I don't care what you do.  So, all right, there it is.
Guys, be safe.
And I'll see you again soon.  Thank you.
